meanings.definition: A small piece or portion of food.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a tasty morselling of cake.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared a plate full of delicious morsellings.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse nibbled on the morselling of cheese.
meanings.sent4: She offered a morselling of advice to her friend.
meanings.sent5: The bird pecked at the morselling of bread crumbs.

meanings.definition: To divide into small pieces or portions.
meanings.sent1: She carefully morselled the cake for sharing.
meanings.sent2: The chef morselled the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: He morselled the paper into tiny bits for the art project.
meanings.sent4: The sun morselled the clouds into beautiful shapes.
meanings.sent5: The wind morselled the leaves across the yard.

meanings.definition: To eat in small bites or pieces.
meanings.sent1: The child morselled the cookie slowly.
meanings.sent2: She morselled the fruit to savor its sweetness.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel morselled the nut with delight.
meanings.sent4: The waves morselled the sand along the shore.
meanings.sent5: He morselled the sandwich while enjoying the view.
